intro: Erigeron glabrescens, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its blue to purple flower heads consist of numerous tiny florets surrounded by white ray flowers. Erigeron glabrescens is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
